Data Consent and Collection.dpdp: Free, specific, informed, unconditional and unambiguous consent required (Section 6)
Data Consent and Collection.rbi: Need-based data collection with prior and explicit consent, audit trail required (Para 12)
Data Consent and Collection.similarity: Both require explicit, informed consent before collecting/processing borrower data
Data Consent and Collection.contradiction: None significant - both align on consent principles

Data Protection Officer/Nodal Officer.dpdp: Significant Data Fiduciaries must appoint DPO based in India (Section 10)
Data Protection Officer/Nodal Officer.rbi: Designate nodal grievance redressal officers for digital lending complaints (Para 11)
Data Protection Officer/Nodal Officer.similarity: Both require dedicated officers for data/grievance handling
Data Protection Officer/Nodal Officer.contradiction: DPDP DPO has broader compliance scope; RBI officer focused on grievance redressal

Data Storage and Localization.rbi: All data must be stored in India; if processed outside, must be deleted within 24 hours (Para 13)
Data Storage and Localization.similarity: Both mandate data localization in India
Data Storage and Localization.contradiction: RBI explicitly mandates 24-hour deletion if data processed outside; DPDP less prescriptive

Data Sharing with Third Parties.dpdp: Explicit consent required before sharing with other Data Fiduciaries (Section 6, 12)
Data Sharing with Third Parties.rbi: Explicit consent required before sharing with any third party except statutory cases (Para 12)
Data Sharing with Third Parties.similarity: Both require explicit consent for third-party data sharing

Data Breach Notification.dpdp: Data Fiduciary must notify Board and affected Data Principals of breach (Section 8)
Data Breach Notification.rbi: Standards for handling security breach mentioned but less prescriptive on notification timeline
Data Breach Notification.similarity: Both require notification of data breaches
Data Breach Notification.contradiction: DPDP has explicit notification mechanism via Board; RBI defers to RE policies

Privacy Policy.dpdp: Not explicitly mandated in the Act itself
Privacy Policy.rbi: Comprehensive privacy policy required, disclosed on website and DLA (Para 14)
Privacy Policy.similarity: Both recognize importance of privacy policies
Privacy Policy.contradiction: RBI more prescriptive on privacy policy disclosure requirements

Grievance Redressal.dpdp: Data Principal has right to grievance redressal (Section 13); must exhaust before approaching Board
Grievance Redressal.rbi: RE and LSP must designate nodal officers; link to RBI CMS and Sachet Portal required (Para 11)
Grievance Redressal.similarity: Both establish tiered grievance redressal with escalation to regulator
Grievance Redressal.contradiction: DPDP escalates to Data Protection Board; RBI escalates to RB-IOS

Right to Erasure.dpdp: Data Principal can request erasure after consent withdrawal or purpose fulfilled (Section 8, 12)
Right to Erasure.rbi: Clear data destruction protocol required; RE responsible for ongoing data security (Para 13)
Right to Erasure.similarity: Both recognize importance of data deletion after purpose served
Right to Erasure.contradiction: DPDP gives Data Principal explicit right to erasure; RBI focuses on RE policy creation

Data Processors.dpdp: Data Processors process data on behalf of Data Fiduciary; Fiduciary remains liable (Section 8)
Data Processors.rbi: LSPs are agents; RE remains fully responsible for LSP acts and omissions (Para 5)
Data Processors.similarity: Both hold primary entity liable for third-party processors

Biometric Data.dpdp: No specific restriction; covered under processing rules
Biometric Data.rbi: RE must ensure no biometric data stored/collected unless allowed under statutory guidelines (Para 13)
Biometric Data.similarity: Both recognize sensitive nature of biometric data
Biometric Data.contradiction: RBI explicitly restricts biometric collection; DPDP treats as regular personal data

Data for Automated Decisions.dpdp: Data used for decisions affecting Data Principal must be complete, accurate, consistent (Section 8)
Data for Automated Decisions.rbi: RE must obtain economic profile (age, occupation, income) for creditworthiness assessment (Para 7)
Data for Automated Decisions.similarity: Both require data quality for decision-making
Data for Automated Decisions.contradiction: DPDP focuses on data accuracy; RBI focuses on sufficiency of assessment data

Special Categories (Children/Vulnerable).dpdp: Verifiable consent from parents/guardians required; tracking/behavioral monitoring prohibited (Section 9)
Special Categories (Children/Vulnerable).rbi: No specific provisions for children in lending guidelines (general lending principles apply)
Special Categories (Children/Vulnerable).similarity: Both recognize need for enhanced protection in certain cases
Special Categories (Children/Vulnerable).contradiction: DPDP has specific child protection rules; RBI digital lending doesn't address minors specifically

Consent Withdrawal.dpdp: Easy withdrawal with ease comparable to giving consent (Section 6)
Consent Withdrawal.rbi: Borrower can opt to restrict data usage; revoke consent to collect personal data (Para 12)
Consent Withdrawal.similarity: Both allow withdrawal of data consent
Consent Withdrawal.contradiction: DPDP mandates ease parity; RBI focuses on options but not ease metric

Legitimate Uses Exception.dpdp: Certain legitimate uses (state functions, legal obligations, medical emergencies) allowed without consent (Section 7)
Legitimate Uses Exception.rbi: Statutory/regulatory data sharing exempted from consent requirement (Para 12)
Legitimate Uses Exception.similarity: Both allow exceptions for regulatory/statutory purposes
Legitimate Uses Exception.contradiction: DPDP has broader list of legitimate uses; RBI narrower focus on regulatory sharing
